Ukrainian security and independence are non-negotiable. We must continue to vigorously pursue all diplomatic solutions to check Putin‚Äôs aggression and build a lasting, multilateral solution to the ongoing crisis in Ukraine.

A war would have profound and devastating consequences for civilians in both countries. And if recent history is any guide, imposing overly broad sanctions will have similarly devastating civilian effects, without meaningful change to Russia‚Äôs unacceptable, aggressive behavior.

As an opponent of war, I strongly condemn Russia's escalation of its 2014 invasion of Ukraine. Putin has repeatedly shown himself to be a violent aggressor, and he now threatens to orchestrate the first major invasion into Europe in 80 years, and destroy Ukrainian democracy.
